reasoning: Rare congenital condition (absent abdominal muscles, urinary tract abnormalities). Incidence ~3 per 100,000 live births based on birth defect registries. Predominantly affects males (95%).
source: Routh JC et al. (2010). Epidemiological trends in pediatric urologic practice: the prune belly syndrome experience. J Urol. 184(4):1702-6
